title: Over Lake Huron, the U.S. downs a 3rd unidentified object in 3 days
description: A unidentified object has been shot down by U.S. forces over Michigan's Lake Huron, according to politicians from the state. It's the fourth aerial shootdown in just over a week in North America.

title: The College Board slams Florida for what it calls 'slander' of AP Black history course
description: Florida officials claimed the new AP African American Studies  course has a "political agenda," but the education nonprofit says state leaders never made any concrete suggestions on how to change it.

title: Black farmers call for justice from the USDA
description: Decades after a major lawsuit against the USDA, Black farmers still face inequality. They say not all settlements from the case made it into their hands, which has exacerbated debt and other problems.

title: Fireworks and 'Death to the dictator': Iranians assess the Revolution, 44 years on
description: Following protests and crackdowns over the past five months, authorities held events to mark the 1979 Revolution this week. They show Iranians have mixed feelings about their nation.

title: Turkey detains building contractors as the quake death toll rises to more than 33,000
description: As rescuers still pulled some from the rubble, Turkish officials detained those allegedly involved in constructing buildings that toppled down and crushed their occupants.

title: Is chocolate good for your heart? Finally the FDA has an answer – kind of
description: For years, chocolate-lovers have pointed to studies suggesting compounds in cocoa may be good for heart health. But some of the recent evidence comes from flavanol-rich cocoa, not from candy bars

title: Musician Steven Van Zandt gifts Jamie Raskin a bandana, wishes him a 'rapid' recovery
description: The Maryland Democrat, who is in treatment for cancer, credited the musician for inspiring him to wear bandanas while he undergoes chemotherapy.
